comments:
When I've changed a file on my local machine and want to see the diffents to 
the latest version in the repository (CVS), I've tried to use the "Synchronize 
with repository..." entry in the context menu. This results in an empty file 
from the repository compared with the local changed.

Created an attachment (id=702)
Synchronize output

Did you find any error information about this in the .log file?
Was it reproducable?
Could you successfully compare other files with the repository?
Did you check whether that version of the file is empty in the repository?

No, there are no more comments or information in the ".log" file. This behavior 
occures with _every_ file I tried to compare from the CVS (the updating and 
commiting of files succeeds, also the synchronization itself). The local 
comparement succeeds too, but not the one between local and CVS files and 
different versions from CVS files (in the second case both views are empty).
Kevin, do you know anything about this problem?

Never heard.

Its possible a warning message is being issued from the CVS server.  We only 
report errors directly to the user -- the other messages (of which there are 
many) go to the CVS Console view.  Reporter should open the CVS Console view 
and try the operation to see if anything is printed there.  Maybe they don't 
have read rights?
awaiting info from reporter

Created an attachment (id=767)
Log file containg one error

No, there are no more messages in the CVS output window. The only thing I can 
see is the attached log file but the message seems to handle an error in the 
debugger...

Moving to debug.  Top of stack reads:

 <status
     code="120"
     severity="ERROR"
     message="Error logged from Debug UI: "
     plugin-id="org.eclipse.debug.ui">
    <exception
       message="Document root element is missing."
       trace="
org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: Document root element is missing.
	at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.fatal(Parser2.java:3182)
	at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.fatal(Parser2.java:3170)
	at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.parseInternal(Parser2.java:501)
	at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.parse(Parser2.java:305)
	at org.apache.crimson.parser.XMLReaderImpl.parse(XMLReaderImpl.java:442)
	at org.apache.crimson.jaxp.DocumentBuilderImpl.parse
(DocumentBuilderImpl.java:185)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin.restoreLaunchHistory
(DebugUIPlugin.java:1227)

The 'Document root element is missing' problem was fixed some time ago (I can't find the original 
PR).  It was related to mixed-mode launching (launchers & launch configurations).
Please verify.

The exception seems not to be responsible for the strange behavior! The general 
problem is still the none existing file on client side I think. If the CVS 
didn't return the requested file to be compared, the compare component cannot 
find the differences. Where is the difference between the "Update" from CVS to 
the "Give me version xx"?

Does this only occur if you sync directly on the file on when you sync on an 
ancestor as well? Also, what build are you running?

This happens even when I used the Sychronize on the File but also when I used 
the command on a parent tree node. I'm currently working with build 20020416.

Could you try a later build and see if the problem is still there. I seem to 
recall that we did have a couple problem back then that may have caused this 
(one involved file > 32K).

CVS is on a (somewhat older Redhat 6.1) Linux:
Concurrent Versions System (CVS) 1.10.7 (client/server)

I once had a report on Option "-C" not supported (by CVS)

The Command:
  ReplaceWith/Latest From Repository

does not work, too. (This should delete the current file and replace
it by the top-level revision from CVS)
That explains it. We only support CVS version 1.11.1 and beyond.

To clerify the above comment, older versions work when using pure cvs commands 
(such as Checkout from the repo view and Team/Update and Commit) but more 
advanced features may not work properly because of their dependence on new 
features (such as the -C flag on update).

Closing assuming problem was combination of debug (fixed) and server version.
If persists on 1.11.1p1 or 1.11.2, please reopen.
